goals.question: What is the distribution of car prices?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of car prices and how they are distributed. It can also help us identify any outliers or unusual patterns in the data.

goals.question: What is the relationship between car price and horsepower?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of car price vs horsepower
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between car price and horsepower. It can also help us identify any outliers or unusual patterns in the data.

goals.question: What is the distribution of car mileage?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of car mileage and how it is distributed. It can also help us identify any outliers or unusual patterns in the data.

goals.question: What is the distribution of car body styles?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of car body styles
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of each car body style in the dataset. It can also help us identify any unusual patterns or trends in the data.

goals.question: What is the relationship between car price and fuel efficiency?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of car price vs fuel efficiency
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between car price and fuel efficiency. It can also help us identify any outliers or unusual patterns in the data.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['price'] = pd.to_numeric(data['price'], errors='coerce')
    plt.hist(data['price'], bins=20, color='green', alpha=0.5)
    plt.axvline(data['price'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f'Median: {data["price"].median():0.2f}')
    plt.xlabel('Price')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of car prices?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.scatter(data['horsepower'], data['price'], alpha=0.5)
    ax.set_xlabel('Horsepower')
    ax.set_ylabel('Price')
    ax.set_title('What is the relationship between car price and horsepower?')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['mileage'] = pd.to_numeric(data['mileage'], errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna(subset=['mileage'])
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.hist(data['mileage'], bins=20, color='blue', edgecolor='black')
    ax.set_xlabel('Mileage')
    ax.set_ylabel('Frequency')
    ax.axvline(data['mileage'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean: {:.2f}'.format(data['mileage'].mean()))
    ax.axvline(data['mileage'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['mileage'].median()))
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    body_styles = data['body_style'].value_counts()
    plt.bar(body_styles.index, body_styles.values)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of car body styles?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['price'] = pd.to_numeric(data['price'], errors='coerce')
    data['mpg'] = pd.to_numeric(data['mpg'], errors='coerce')
    plt.scatter(data['price'], data['mpg'])
    plt.title('What is the relationship between car price and fuel efficiency?')
    plt.xlabel('Price')
    plt.ylabel('Fuel Efficiency')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['mileage'] = pd.to_numeric(data['mileage'], errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna(subset=['mileage'])
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.hist(data['mileage'], bins=20, color='blue', edgecolor='black')
    ax.set_xlabel('Mileage')
    ax.set_ylabel('Frequency')
    ax.axvline(data['mileage'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean: {:.2f}'.format(data['mileage'].mean()))
    ax.axvline(data['mileage'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['mileage'].median()))
    plt.legend()
    return plt;
